item.title: Unveiling the Secrets of Linux Core Dumps
item.description: Understanding Core Dumps: Analysis of their Purpose and Risks A Linux core dump, also known as a core dump file, is a file that captures the memory contents of a running process when it encounters a critical error or crashes.
